metadata.name: Brief Resilience Scale
metadata.authors: Smith, B. W., Dalen, J., Wiggins, K., Steger, M. F., & Tooley, E.
metadata.citation: Smith, B. W., Dalen, J., Wiggins, K., Steger, M. F., & Tooley, E. (2008). The Brief Resilience Scale: Assessing the ability to bounce back. International Journal of Behavioral Medicine, 15(3), 194-200.
metadata.license: Published instrument, freely available for research use

items.text: I tend to bounce back quickly after hard times.
I have a hard time making it through stressful events.
It does not take me long to recover from a stressful event.
It is hard for me to snap back when something bad happens.
I usually come through difficult times with little trouble.
I tend to take a long time to get over set-backs in my life.

validation.sample_description: Multiple samples including undergraduate students and cardiac rehabilitation patients (Smith et al., 2008)
